results.title: White heat
results.creator_credit: Raoul Walsh, Louis F. Edelman and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: The searing classic featuring the last great gangster performance by the legendary James Cagney. In 1931, Cagney stunned audiences with his portrayal of a no-good street punk in “Public Enemy” and helped define the screens’ image of underworld thugs. In “White Heat” he expands that image with a blistering performance as psychotic gangland kingpin Cody Jarrett. Devoted to his hard boiled Ma and possessed of an itchy trigger finger, Jarrett is a study of unequalled ferocity, a walking timebomb who robs, tortures and kills without conscience. When he is finally captured, Jarrett escapes a murder rap by doing time for a lesser crime. Still, “The Big House” cannot hold him and he escapes into one of the most famous finales of movie history. Driven by Raoul Walsh’s keen direction and Cagney’s vivid, hypnotic characterisation, “White Heat” won Life Magazine’s kudos as a wild and exciting picture of mayhem and madness.

results.title: Thoroughly modern Millie
results.creator_credit: George Roy Hill, Ross Hunter, Ross Hunter Productions and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: The Roaring Twenties come to life in this Academy Award winning musical starring Julie Andrews as the naive Millie, a country girl who comes to the big city in search of a husband. She befriends the sweet Miss Dorothy played by Mary Tyler Moore, fends off white slaver Mrs. Meers (Beatrice Lillie) and meets up with Muzzy played by Carol Channing who manages to solve all of Millie’s romantic problems which involve her boss (John Gavin) and paperclip salesman James Fox.

results.title: Beauty and the beast: the enchanted christmas
results.creator_credit: Andy Knight and Walt Disney Television Animation
results.brief_description: Belle vows to bring a little of the Christmas spirit into the Beast’s castle, even though he has lots of misgivings about the success of her plans. All the enchanted objects chip in, even the reluctant Angelique, a beautiful tree ornament. The evil Forte, a pipe organ wants to undo all of Belle’s plans and so spoil Christmas for everyone, but as in all good fairy tales, it all ends up happily ever after with the Christmas spirit intact.

results.title: Half a sixpence
results.creator_credit: George Sidney, Charles H. Schneer and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on the H.G. Wells novel ‘Kipps’, Tommy Steele stars as Arthur Kipp, a young draper’s assistant who inherits a fortune and enters Edwardian society. Arthur finds out that wealth doesn’t necessarily buy happiness. Apart from the lavish costumes, this production features some big numbers such as the title song and the wonderful “What a picture’. Also stars Julia Foster.

results.title: The Baby of Macon
results.creator_credit: Peter Greenaway, Kees Kasander, La Sept, UGC Images and Channel Four
results.brief_description: Peter Greenaway’s film is visually sumptuous and confronting. Inspired by images of billboards featuring young children as icons, Greenaway’s film is set in the seventeenth century where child martyrs were similarly exploited. Rape, death, dismemberment occur when a miraculous child is the subject of a play that becomes too real. Stars Ralph Fiennes and Julia Ormond.

results.title: I accuse = J'accuse
results.brief_description: Considered to be one of the most important anti-war films ever made, Abel Gance’s 1939 film is a remake of his original 1919 silent film. With the prospect of World War 2 imminent, gabel reconstructed his original to challenge the world. Jean Diaz is a research scientist who dedicates his life to ending war. When he discovers that his work is being exploited by the military, he summons up the ghosts of the war dead to make the world come to its senses.

results.title: Andre
results.creator_credit: George Miller, Annette Handley, Adam Shapiro and Kushner-Locke Production
results.brief_description: Andre, an adorable seal is orphaned when his mother is caught in a fishing net. The harbour master, his wife and three children adopt the lovable pup and nurse him back to health. Andre forms a special relationship with seven year-old tomboy Toni and the two prove that true friendship can survive the toughest trials.

results.title: Free Willy 2: the adventure home
results.creator_credit: Dwight Little, Jennie Lew-Tugend, Lauren Shuler, Donner Productions and Shuler-Donner
results.brief_description: Jesse is reunited with his Orca friend Willy who has rejoined his family in the wild. Willy becomes trapped by an oil spill fire and Jesse is determined to rescue Willy even if it means risking his own life. Action packed adventure with superb photography, this is a film to be shared by all the family and lovers of whales.

results.title: The Birthday party
results.creator_credit: William Friedkin, Milton Subotsky, Max J Rosenberg and Palomar Pictures
results.brief_description: Screenplay written by Harold Pinter. In a shabby seaside English boarding house, a man’s inability to cope with his fears and guilt comes to the surface. At first, in typical Pinter style, the conversation is trivial and banal but deepens and erupts from the commonplace and comic into terror. Stars Robert Shaw, Patrick Magee and Dandy Nichols.

results.title: The Indian in the cupboard
results.creator_credit: Frank Oz, Jane Startz, Frank Marshall, Kathleen Kennedy, Scholastic Productions and Kennedy/Marshall Company
results.brief_description: Based on the book by Lynne Reid Banks, ‘The Indian in the cupboard’ is a heartwarming adventure about nine year old Omri who magically brings his three-inch toy Indian Little Bear to life. Some of the scenes may not be suitable for very young children however the amazing adventures of these two friends is sure to delight.
